intro: Pedicularis stenotheca, commonly known as the narrow-capsule lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Pedicularis stenotheca is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, growing in open, rocky areas with well-drained soil.
